# Java II - Final Project Specification

Version: Spring 2024 1.0

## Goal

The final project will encompass the majority of the major topics
covered in CSC 2212 and incorporate them into a single assignment to tie
concepts together.

## Process Requirements

- The process of developing the final project including producing design documentation and code shall be the result of the student.
  - Help may be provided by me and may include examples provided as CYUs, Lab starting points, or class examples
  - **However, work must be added or changed to these starting points to count as meeting the requirements**
- [x] UML class diagrams representing the coded implementation shall be submitted.
- [ ] Code shall be submitted with comments referencing the requirements below as "D1" or "F1", etc....
- [ ] For **each** requirement met in the code, the rationale shall be described in the comments.
  - "D1 - I chose to use a polymorphic reference using an interface here because...."
- [ ] A functioning demonstration shall be provided

## Design Requirements

- [x] D1 - The project shall demonstrate Polymorphic references using interfaces in their most logical and appropriate uses
- [x] D2 - The project shall demonstrate Polymorphic references using subclassing in their most logical and appropriate uses
- [x] D3 - The project shall demonstrate the use of at least one abstract class
- [x] D4 - The project shall demonstrate the use of sub-classing where a method (non-`{java}abstract`) is overridden requiring use the `{java}super` keyword
- [x] D5 - The project shall demonstrate the use of a callback using an functional interface and a Lambda expression
- [x] D6 - The project shall demonstrate the use of a callback using an instance of an anonymous class
- [x] D7 - The project shall demonstrate the use of an Inner Class
  - This is a help to be able to make your GUI have easily shared data with objects...
- [x] D8 - The project shall demonstrate proper use of a Aggregation/Composition relationship
- [x] D9 - The project shall demonstrate proper use of a dependency relationship
- [x] D10 - The project shall be a simulation using a model of real-world thing or concept: game, store, bank/atm, business tool, communication app
- [x] D11 - The project shall include a new Exception class related to the project
- [x] D12 - The project shall throw this new Exception at the appropriate time
- [x] D13 - The project shall handle this new Exception

## Functional Requirements

- [x] F1 - The project shall demonstrate the use of at least one Graphical User Interface component that accepts input from the user and triggers a reaction described in \[F2\]
  - Inputs may include mouse clicking on certain component, typing in text data, selecting checkboxes, selecting radio buttons, or other inputs
- [x] F2 - The project shall demonstrate adding or removing GUI components based on user entry
- [x] F3 - The project shall demonstrate the use of at least one Graphical User Interface component (different than \[F1\]) that accepts input from the user and triggers a reaction described in \[F4\]
  - Inputs may include mouse clicking on certain component, typing in text data, selecting checkboxes, selecting radio buttons, or other inputs
- [x] F4 - The project shall demonstrate changing the properties of a visual element based on the user entry.

## Bonus Requirements

- Implement recursion in some part of the project
- Implement Sorting and Searching in some part of the project

## Ideas

- Anything you want that meets the requirements <img
  src="data:image/png;base64,"
  class="emoji" alt="smiley" />
- Metaverse product store (though with additional
  capabilities/properties)
- ATM that has multiple bank accounts/customers
- ...
